name: Jeannie's Kickin' Fried Fish
author: crabbyjean
summary: This was one of those recipes I created when I was cleaning out my spice cabinet! Everyone asks me for this recipe!
ingredients: 1 pound tilapia fillets, rinsed and patted dry
½ cup Italian seasoned bread crumbs (such as Progresso®)
1 teaspoon blackened seasoning (such as Old Bay®)
¼ teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, or to taste
¼ teaspoon freshly ground sea salt, or to taste
directions: Beat the egg with milk in a shallow bowl
In another shallow bowl, mix together the bread crumbs, roasted onion flakes, garlic, blackened seasoning, crushed red pepper flakes, black pepper, and sea salt
Dip a tilapia fillet into the egg mixture, then press gently into the crumb mixture on both sides; set the coated fillet onto a plate
Repeat with remaining fillets; refrigerate the coated fillets for about 15 minutes to help set the crumbs
Heat the olive oil and butter in a cast-iron frying pan over medium heat
Lay the fillets into the skillet, and pan-fry until golden brown on each side, about 3 minutes per side
The fish should be opaque and flaky underneath the coating
Remove and drain fillets on paper towels
